reviewText: Sitting in your lazy-e boy recliner flipping through the channels on the television...  yawn, boring, nothing to watch.  You flip off the television and the first rumblings in your stomach begins..  You know it's about that time, pushing in the foot rest you stand up and head toward your kitchen.  The rumbling in your stomach gives you a swift kick in the gut just as you pass the threshold to your kitchen.  Walking to the fridge you pop open the door and peer inside..  Just like every other man in history, you stand there for much longer than you should, hoping that the longer you search the greater the chances of something you like appearing.  Like millions of men before you and millions of men after you you shut the door in disgust as nothing you like appeared.  Weighing the options in your mind you realize you're left with the prospect of eating two week old bread, a zip lock bag containing meatloaf from a month ago and some baking soda..\n\nLike the great comedies of old a tiny light bulb goes off in your mind...  bright and flashing.. the idea of hitting up your local burger place flies into your mind.  The food normally goes in one end and out the other in less than an hour but at the very least the cute girl you've been crushing on for the last year normally works the counter around this time  (not that you've gone there enough to know that information).  Maybe this time you might actually garner up the courage to say something other than.. I'll take a number 1".  Walking casually toward your front door
recommended: the one adorned with a green zombie.  Rethinking your decision you slowly shake your head and decide to grab the leather jacket you got last Christmas but never bothered to wear.  "Welp
hoursPlayed: now's as good a time as any."\n\nSlamming the door shut behind you

reviewText: Until they decide to fix the god aweful pathing of the Zombie I don't recommend this game. I Really like the look and feel of this game, and really the pathing is the biggest downfall of this game.\n\nImagine clicking and dragging a dotted line from your zombie to it's attack point, lining everything up nicely, you get halfway through the map and realise inorder to get the last guy you must zig zag inbetween 8 obsticals placed very close together. You only have one Gaint left and two little guys, there is only the Blonde female with the faster firing 6 shot pistel. You draw your line, it seems like the pathing will be good and then your giant gets stuck on the first corner and your little guys rush out and get killed. Well crap, now you have to restart over. You get to the same point but this time you make sure the big guy doesn't get stuck and now your little guys got stuck on corner 2 and 3, Big guy went down and now the little guys are dead too. Okay restart again. You get to the same point but this time you take 3 minutes slowly drawing the line to make sure that they won't get stuck. They get stuck. FML

reviewText:
Plight of the Zombie is a well designed puzzle game that represents the second foray onto Steam following the mixed reaction to the free to play Firefly Online Cortex which was released in January, 2015. That game was designed to be a short term solution until their much awaited Firefly Online was released. Unfortunately that game has not come out and shows no signs of being released anytime soon as there has been a significant number of delays at this point and fans of the television show have grown tired and frustrated with the developer’s efforts on that game.

However, that is not this game – this particular focus is on Plight of the Zombie. It’s actually a pretty solid puzzle game. You need to engineer a route for your zombies around the map in order for them to eat the brains that are scattered around the screen and create new zombies by attacking the humans. Sounds easy, right? Well it is to a certain extent. Those pesky humans hunting you down will pick apart the weakness of your character and eat you for lunch if you’re not careful.

There are 60 action packed levels for you to solve and the beauty of the game lies in the fact that just as one mechanic is seemingly growing old and you complete one set of levels you get to get a new zombie to star in the next set. For example you start off with Craig who is pretty much your weak generic zombie. He’s really a tutorial mode dude. He’s there to teach you the mechanics. Then you move onto Charlie Chunker whose a big fat zombie who can take a lot of damage before he’s shot to death. His issue, however, is that he cannot fit into small spaces so in order to advance throughout some levels you’re going to have to get a Craig like zombie who can do the work that Charlie cannot.

By successfully completing levels you’re going to get zombie coins as well as brains. The brains just tell you how well you have done on a level using the gold-silver-bronze system. The coins, however, are the interesting part. There’s a zombie shop in the game where you can buy cosmetic upgrades. These just change the appearance of your zombies but I have to say that it’s a pretty sweet touch to the game.

The game functions, looks and plays as well as I would hope for. I enjoy the graphics and the cool soundtrack as well. But I am left just a little bit disappointed. Regulars will already know my stance on puzzle games and achievements. They go hand in hand. This is no exception. I’d love for the devs to truly embrace Steam. Please add achievements into your game and consider the Steam Trading Card program as well. Achievements would work wonders in this game. They’ve got the cosmetics store, etc. and thus there are a number of different layers of achievements that should be added. How about some for items purchased from the store, for equipping certain objects onto specific characters on top of those of level completion, etc. It would be a relatively quick process that would add enormous value to the game.

Plight of the Zombie is an already pretty rock solid puzzle game that could be made better quite easily by simply embracing the Steam platform. I do hope that the developers give Steam users an extrinsic award for playing their game. Even without the achievements I would consider the game to be a fairly easy one to recommend for fans of puzzle games.

For similar reviews and our popular daily giveaways visit http://www.steamified.com/
Please feel free to join our wonderful community on Steam

reviewText: This casual reverse tower defense game has a very cute aesthetic with simple, yet harder to master, gameplay which has the potential to entertain you for a couple hours.  Even more if you're the hardcore" type that has the intrinsic need to complete every challenge and gather every collectible.\n\nThe whole game revolves around creating a route for your zombies to mindlessly follow to collect brains and turn every human enemy into a zombie ally
date: even if that means having to place them into strategically thought out suicidal situations. Different zombie types are introduced at the beginning of certain zones with different abilities to help you complete the zone. Clicking on a zombie to pause them in their tracks adds to the strategy needed to navigate the field as gun wielding humans scan and guard a predetermined area or path. If a zombie falls within their field of view
recommended: things can get deadly for the cute zombies and if it was unplanned
hoursPlayed: it means you failed to think quickly and effectively... most of the time.\n\nIt doesn't come without its own faults though. There are some basic physics interactions for certain objects that your zombie has to plow through to get to a human. This is a neat effect but this is where the minor frustrations begin. Zombies may get stuck attempting to navigate around one of these objects as they attempt to clear a path to continue on their mission. Instead they may find themselves simply kicking or pushing it continuously in front of them before they either get stuck or take a while to find a way around the object. There were also a few times where it was difficult to draw a valid path past some areas due to the size of the opening
voteText: but they were few and far between. For a game that relies heavily on this concept
helpfulPercent: it would be best to fix the zombie pathing issues to make this a solid game.\n\nThe minor frustrations can be overlooked due to the length that it takes to complete each level. They are quick and fun
votesHelpful: so if it fails to go as planned the first few times
votesTotal: resetting the level is an instant click away."

reviewText:
A bit of fun puzzler.
You are the zombie, trying to grab all the brains before they time out. But people keep trying to shoot you.
Humans are the worst. :(
Grab a live meat bag to convert him into a zombie and use them as a zombie shield against the gun fire.

Nice twist on a classic genre.

reviewText: Great puzzle/strategy game kept me interested without being brutal or too easy. I really liked the artwork and the fact that you could earn coins to dress up your zombies. This game made me want to keep every zombie I had alive" made me sad when I had to sacrifice some for the greater good. Love the artwork and music. The cons are that the game is short and there are only a couple of different types of zombies hopefully there will be more added soon. The zombie can get stuck along the path but once you get used to the zombies radius it isn't much of an issue."

reviewText:
I honestly never tought zombie games can be innovative or that we will ever hear other side of the story.
Playing as zombie is really rare these days and even when we do it's fast paced not strategy game.
It takes brains , cordination and few tries on harder levels.

Pros:
-Innovative for a zombie game
-Small background to every character
-Nice music and sound effects
-Nice mechanics
-Challenging
-Decent graphics

Cons:
-Repetitive
-Small amount of levels
-Can get frustrating
-Small amount of playable characters

I recommend it to people who like puzzles , those with lots of free time and those who want to try something different.
Overall score 6/10
If you see this in bundle or on sale definetly take it.

reviewText:
An interesting concept, in the saturated Zombie genre, helps Plight of the Zombie stand out as a fun puzzle game. Minor control issues are outweighed by what it has to offer and for £3.99 i would highly reccomend it for anyone into puzzle games or zombies!

Pros
- Great humor and charm
- makes you care about Zombies
- Ineresting Puzzle concepts
- varying gameplay elements (Zombies with unique abilities)
- Can outfit Zombies with cool hats!

Cons
- Controls can be a little awkward and fiddly at times.
